content.description: A series of tough moves protected by bolts leads to a break halfway. Shake out and cruise the chickenhead highway to the top.
content.location: To the right of the giant chimney system called "Cave Passage".

content.description: Start up 20 feet of easy slab to a ledge on the left side of a blunt arete. Clip the first bolt and begin moving up and around to the right face of the arete. From here, good holds lead to a tricky traverse and a powerful move gets you to jugs that lead to the anchor.
content.location: On the blunt arete that begins about 20 feet up. Left of Temptation and Nomar.

content.description: Scramble up the unprotected start to clip the first bolt. Travel up through some awesome terrain on vertical seams and horizontal edges to the top. The rock is more solid than it appears from the ground.
content.protection: 5 bolts to the anchor. Rap Rings at the top.

content.description: Mega sandbagged and sustained mixed route. A large handful of difficult and sequential slab moves lead to an easy roof with mossy slopers above.
content.protection: Mixed Route. 3 bolts + standard rack. 2 bolts. Not equipped to lower.
content.location: First route around the point when walking counter clockwise. Directly across from Slackline Pillar. I climbed Arsenic and Lace(7) first then walked over to the anchors for this route and set up a top-rope and clipped three bolts on the way down for redirects.

content.description: A difficult (5.10ish) move to the first good hold. From here, follow the bolts as they traverser right along a good hand crack. The crux comes at the third bolt. After the crux climb quickly to fight the pump through sustained crimps and jugs. Watch out for the death block near the final bolt! It's marked with an X. There is a good hold just above it.
content.location: As you round the corner near Slackline Pillar you will see bolts on the north face under a small roof. These bolts belong to a 12a mixed line called Death Storm. The second set of bolts is Great Expectations. Great Expectations shares the first bolt with a 10a called El Regalo. For the 11b, clip the first bolt then head right.

content.description: A good sustained 5.10 sport climb. A great warm up for Great Expectations.
content.location: Shares the same first bolt as Great Expectations, but then continues straight up, not right.

content.description: Climb easy, moss-covered holds to to a ledge. From here, enjoy consistent climbing protected by gear and bolts.
content.location: Right around the arete from Twizzler. Look for the bolt above the horizontal break about 15 feet above the mossy ledge. This is the only route on this side of the wall.

content.description: This is a great moderate trad line. Work up the easy pillar and right facing dihedral into an obvious corner hand crack. There aren't many features for about 6 ft, forcing the climber to use a few hand jams.
content.protection: Standard Rack. No anchor. There are a few bolts on top of the cliff, but these are for setting a high line between the bluff and Slack line Pillar. They are not equipped for lowering or rappel.
content.location: On the main bluff across from Slackline Pillar.

content.description: This is the north facing wall near Slackline Pillar and Slanted Pillar. Home to the hardest route at Stack: Nomar 12c.
